snippet: In remarkably conciliatory language, a synod of bishops appeared to reflect the more tolerant and inclusive direction Pope Francis has set for the church.
abstract: Assembly of Roman Catholic bishops convened by Pope Francis at Vatican releases preliminary document calling for church to welcome and accept gay people, unmarried couples and those who have divorced, as well as children of these less traditional families; bishops' report does not change church doctrine or teaching, and will be subjected to fierce debate and revision at the assembly.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Vatican City, and Laurie Goodstein from Northampton, Mass.

lead_paragraph: In remarkably conciliatory language, a synod of bishops appeared to reflect the more tolerant and inclusive direction Pope Francis has set for the church.
